remarks: An infinite series converges, if and only if the series does with initial terms removed.  (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 9-Feb-2008.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Apr-2014.)
statement:
clim2ser.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
iserex.2 $e |- ( ph -> N e. Z ) $.
iserex.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) e. CC ) $.
iserex $p |- ( ph -> ( seq M ( + , F ) e. dom ~~> <-> seq N ( + , F ) e. dom ~~> ) ) $.
$d F k $.
$d M k $.
$d N k $.
$d Z k $.
$d k ph $.
